issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: YARN Native Service: Respect YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS specified in service spec

comments.body: Thanks for reporting this, [~leftnoteasy] - {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_MOUNTS}} is intended to be used for the purpose you call out. When that variable was added, {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS}} was retained due to its existing use in native services. Is there a case where {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_MOUNTS}} won't work for your need? Maybe it is time we look to consolidate these two.

Thanks [~shanekumpf@gmail.com], I think we should consolidate the two, and the backward compatibility is not an issue because a. 3.1.0 is an unstable release, b. the variable itself is marked as {{@private}}
[~shanekumpf@gmail.com] [~leftnoteasy] could you please review the change?

javac fails because deprecating {{ENV_DOCKER_CONTAINER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS}} introduces more warnings:
{quote}
[WARNING] /testptch/hadoop/hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/yarn/server/nodemanager/containermanager/linux/runtime/TestDockerContainerRuntime.java:[1101,35] [deprecation] ENV_DOCKER_CONTAINER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS in DockerLinuxContainerRuntime has been deprecated
[WARNING] /testptch/hadoop/hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/yarn/server/nodemanager/containermanager/linux/runtime/TestDockerContainerRuntime.java:[1121,35] [deprecation] ENV_DOCKER_CONTAINER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS in DockerLinuxContainerRuntime has been deprecated
[WARNING] /testptch/hadoop/hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/yarn/server/nodemanager/containermanager/linux/runtime/TestDockerContainerRuntime.java:[1174,35] [deprecation] ENV_DOCKER_CONTAINER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS in DockerLinuxContainerRuntime has been deprecated
[WARNING] /testptch/hadoop/hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/yarn/server/nodemanager/containermanager/linux/runtime/TestDockerContainerRuntime.java:[1194,35] [deprecation] ENV_DOCKER_CONTAINER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS in DockerLinuxContainerRuntime has been deprecated
{quote}

[~csingh],

Thanks for working on the fix. I think we don't need to keep the old env and related logic since it is marked as private.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/YARN-5534?focusedCommentId=16259990&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-16259990

Referencing the above comment, I think we can remove {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS}}. 

cc. [~shanekumpf@gmail.com] [~billie.rinaldi]
Fine with me. Also, I think the syntax is "source:target:ro,source:target:ro" for read-only mounts (right, [~shanekumpf@gmail.com]?)

Patch 2:
 * removes {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS}}
 * Changes to {{TestDockerContainerRuntime}} to use {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_MOUNTS}}. Removed a test that was already there for {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_MOUNTS}}.
* Yarn service {{AbstractLauncher}} appends "ro" to mount paths.

cc. [~shanekumpf@gmail.com] [~billie.rinaldi] [~leftnoteasy]

Thanks [~csingh], 

Overall patch looks good, it gonna be better to make sure native service is not broken by this. Could you try this on a cluster and see if it works?

Thanks for the patch [~csingh]! Overall this is headed in the right direction.

There is an issue with the current approach that needs to be addressed for this to work properly. {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS}} was designed to work with Localized Resources. As a result, the "source" of the mounts added in {{AbstractLauncher}} are all relative paths. These need to be specified as absolute paths in the final mount that is added to the {{docker run}} command. See {{DockerLinuxContainerRuntime#validateMount}} on how the relative paths were converted to absolute paths prior to this change. If you plan to handle this another way, {{DockerLinuxContainerRuntime#validateMount}} should be removed as it is no longer being used.

Also, {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS}} is still documented in DockerContainers.md and should be removed.

[~shanekumpf@gmail.com] Thanks for pointing out the issue.
{quote}As a result, the "source" of the mounts added in {{AbstractLauncher}} are all relative paths. These need to be specified as absolute paths in the final mount that is added to the {{docker run}} command
{quote}
I think it may be better not to get rid of {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS}} at this point because

{{AbstractLauncher}} in Yarn service while creating the {{LaunchContext}} doesn't know about the absolute path of the localized resource. 

I can put a simple fix to merge user specified {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS}} with the once computed by yarn service for the issue reported by [~leftnoteasy]

Let me know your thoughts?

Thanks [~csingh] / [~shanekumpf@gmail.com] for the discussion.

I agree that at this time, it's better to not remove YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS. As proposed by Chandni, we should simply merge computed by service framework and whatever provided by user.

[~shanekumpf@gmail.com] I don't see any issues with the approach you mentioned. However, I wanted to avoid making changes to Yarn core which seemed riskier.

I can create another ticket to address consolidating {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_MOUNTS}} and {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS}} for the next release and work on it.

Let me know if this sounds good to you?

{quote}I agree that at this time, it's better to not remove YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS
{quote}
Fair enough. the original environment variable does make the intent explicit for relative source paths.

However, YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS won't work for '/etc/passwd' as originally described in this issue, this is what YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_MOUNTS is for. Can you help me understand the use case in allowing the user to provide YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS? I'm struggling to come up with a good use case for this.
I agree, the user does not need to set YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS. They should go through the configuration files API to get local resources mounted into a container.

[~shanekumpf@gmail.com], an example is user stores hadoop configs to HDFS, which will be automatically saved to container's local folder. And YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS can be used to be mounted when container being launched. This is useful for rolling upgrade case which application should not read /etc/hadoop/conf directly.
[~leftnoteasy], the user should make them STATIC configuration files in that case, and the AM will automatically set up YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS.

We had a discussion offline that 
* [~leftnoteasy]'s use-case is unblocked by providing configuration files in the spec
* Will convert this jira to remove {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS}}. {{YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_MOUNTS}} can support user specified mounts of localized resources as well. 
* Mark this jira for next release.

Patch 4: addresses review comments by [~shanekumpf@gmail.com]
[~shanekumpf@gmail.com] [~billie.rinaldi] [~leftnoteasy] could you please review patch 4?

[~csingh] Thank you for the patch, a few nits:

FindAbsoluteMount method can be skipped.  Container-executor looks up source mount location and comparing the absolute path to the white list mount (YARN-5534).

DockerContainers.md still have reference to YARN_CONTAINER_RUNTIME_DOCKER_LOCAL_RESOURCE_MOUNTS.  This can be removed as well.
Patch 5 contains the change to DockerContainers.md
Patch 6 : renamed findAbsoluteMount to mountReadOnlyPath
